author: A_Brickset_user
review: This was the first Lego set I ever recived, and as such its one of my all time favorites. Come with all the trademarks of M:Tron, transparent neon green pieces and a magnet holder and box. Its a great looking space craft as well, deffinately worth buying.

author: zinkk757
title: 4/5 great source for wings
review: This set is really cool and has 5 great wing peices to use for other things .  The actuall set has a nice logo on the front, a typicall panel, two antennas that have two rotating hook bricks to lock down thye windsheild, a single m-tron figure, and 2 antennas.  It's not a bad set and i really enjoy it.

author: nateholio
title: One Set With Many Uses
review:
This is a neat little set with many possible uses.

As it is an M-Tron set, it's obviously used in some way to support mining of trans-neon green nodules. Of course, it has a small lockbox that attaches to the back via magnets, but I can see it also being used to scout for possible mining areas using the two side scanning cone sensors next to the pilot and transmitting the coordinates back to Mega Core Magnetizer using the two antennas on top. Then there is the possibility of defending M-Tron areas and vehicles with the two dish shaped weapons up front.

Pros:
-Great locking mechanism for the windscreen
-Two antennas mounted in a cool looking fashion
-Overall good form

Cons:
-Magnet in back should have been moved out a bit so it could easily haul the large equipment pallets found in big M-Tron sets
-Needs a place for a miner to sit behind the pilot

author: dforce
title: Awsome little spacecraft
review:
I have got it from an internet store alongside with Pulsar charger and Beacon tracer.
I really love old space sets, especially m:tron. Now onto the pros and cons!

Pros:

  • Cool Weapons
  • Printed pieces
  • Cool color scheme
  • Trans-neongreen parts
  • Magnet
  • Little container box
  • Cockpit closing mechanism

Cons:

  • Magnet is wobbly
  • Antennaes tend to fall of

That's it

author: James83
title: M-Tron Dream Chaser
review:
I think the M-Tron theme had some of the best looking spaceships Lego ever designed and this set is no exception.

The Vehicle

This search craft is a good looking spacecraft. There are several wing bricks which give a futuristic aerodynamic shape but with biplane wing charm. The nose cone features two green dishes (radars or lazers) topped with a printed M-Tron sloping brick. The top wings have thruster units attached underneath and there are two cone-shaped rockets underneath the main body. The cockpit spacious enough to allow the minifigure to sit with his airtanks on and the control panel is a standard M-Tron computer brick. The canopy is hinged at the front and has an ingenious but very simple locking device attached to the two antennas at the rear. Magnets and M-Tron's are an inseparable pairing and at the rear is a magnet holding a standard M-Tron container, you get two green light bricks to use as cargo. The magnet wobbles slightly but is securely fixed. Overall this isn't a complicated build but it does include a lot of wing and fin parts which are handy for building other craft with. It is also a sturdy build, even when flying it around the room by hand. The only nitpick is that there is nowhere to stow the hand-held Radio so the pilot has to carry it all the time.

The Minifigure

A standard M-Tron figure with a hand-held Radio piece. 

Personal Developments

Being of such a sound design with cool looks I kept this set intact until I could resist recycling its wing parts no longer, it needed few additions beyond a clip brick to hold the Radio.
